metadata.subject: Re: EUROPEAN MULTI ASSET COVERAGE MEETING IMPRESSIONS: Eyes on Real Money outflows; Christmas comes early for most of macro players, hedge funds. Absolute majority bet on HRC to win, but majority still made good money because ....

relationships.description: Email correspondence sharing financial market analysis
Financial Reporter at New York Times
Sales or Trading function at Deutsche Bank

analysis.purpose: To share financial market analysis and hedge fund perspectives on post-election market movements
analysis.significance: Shows Jeffrey Epstein communicating with a New York Times financial reporter about market analysis and sharing proprietary Deutsche Bank insights

concerns: Potential sharing of proprietary financial analysis from Deutsche Bank to external parties

notable_quotes: Absolute majority bet on HRC to win, but majority still made good money because Hillary bets worked as Trump trades.
Real Money is on the ropes, caught long Fixed Income/duration/carry and cannot play defense fearing Outflows.
This material was prepared by a Sales or Trading function within Deutsche Bank AG... and was not produced, reviewed or edited by the Research Department.
red_flags: Sharing proprietary financial institution analysis with journalist

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this financial market analysis email

illegal_activity.description: Email contains forwarded financial market analysis from Deutsche Bank, not first-hand illegal activity

details: Recipient is Landon Thomas Jr., Financial Reporter at New York Times
Document contains financial market analysis being shared with journalist

public_knowledge.context: Financial market analysis from major banks is typically proprietary information, making this sharing with a journalist notable

analysis.summary: Jeffrey Epstein forwards Deutsche Bank's proprietary financial market analysis to New York Times reporter Landon Thomas Jr., discussing post-2016 election market movements, hedge fund performance, and the 'Trump Reflation Theme' impacting global markets including emerging markets, currencies, and equities.
